title: Andrea Bocelli delivers heartwarming performance at 'We Love NYC'
description: Italian superstar Andrea Bocelli performs "O Sole Mio" at "We Love NYC: The Homecoming Concert" in New York City's Central Park.

title: Biden's failing global Covid-19 response
description: Have we been duped? Just a few months ago, our organizations, Universities Allied for Essential Medicines and Health Global Access Project, celebrated President Joe Biden's support to temporarily waive intellectual property (IP) for Covid-19 vaccines. For a moment, we had hoped that this commitment to global solidarity would be the beginning of the end of this pandemic for everyone, everywhere. Now, with little effort spent to build support for this IP waiver, refusal to commit to the World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General's plea for a moratorium on booster vaccinations until at least 10% of every country has been vaccinated, and a global response plan with little more than platitudes, Biden's statements of support have proved to be empty words.

title: Afghanistan's first female Olympian says women will not give up their liberties easily
description: Friba Rezayee made history in 2004 when she became one of the first two Afghan women to compete at the Olympic Games.

title: A man was found dead at New York's Citi Field baseball park
description: A man was found dead at a baseball park in New York on Friday after falling from the second-floor staircase.

title: Sean Penn compares being unvaccinated with pointing a gun at someone
description: Sean Penn tells CNN's Michael Smerconish that people who are unvaccinated need to realize that resisting getting the shot is not a sign of independence, rather it's in opposition to the kind of inter-dependence that has made the country successful.

title: What should you do if you get a breakthrough infection? Our expert weighs in
description: Covid-19 vaccines are very effective against preventing infection, but no vaccine is 100% effective. Fully vaccinated people can and do become infected. It's not known exactly how many of these breakthrough infections are occurring, as the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is not collecting national data this comprehensive. Based on reports from 25 states that do keep track of these data, the Kaiser Family Foundation estimates that the rate of breakthrough infections is well below 1%.

title: Sex workers helped popularize OnlyFans. Now their future on the platform is uncertain
description: After years of working to build their audiences on OnlyFans, a number of sex workers and adult content creators are now grappling with the sudden blow of potentially losing their incomes and access to the fans who have paid their bills.

title: Harvey Elliott: 'Everybody wants to talk' about the 18-year-old, says Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp
description: Diogo Jota and Sadio Mane scored Liverpool's goals in the 2-0 Premier League win over Burnley, but it was the performance of teenager Harvey Elliott that really caught the eye on Saturday.

title: What's causing the crisis on the Belarus-Lithuania border?
description: In recent years, Europe's migration troubles have entailed people arriving from the south and east, fleeing conflict and economic deprivation over land routes and in boats often unfit for Mediterranean waters.

title: These great apes share salutations — just like humans
description: What makes humans a successful species?

title: Trump heads to Alabama, but his Covid politics are everywhere
description: Former President Donald Trump still towers over the GOP, and he's set to appear Saturday at an Alabama rally. And ambitious Republicans eyeing future White House bids are increasingly emulating his brand of confrontational, fact-challenged politics on Covid.

title: Nicole Kidman takes 'Nine Perfect Strangers' on a dark ride and more
description: Could you use a bit of a retreat?

title: Cristiano Ronaldo has 'told me that he's staying,' says Juventus coach Massimiliano Allegri
description: Cristiano Ronaldo has "never wanted to leave Juventus," according to the club's coach Massimiliano Allegri.

title: Country Music Hall of Fame artist Tom T. Hall dies at age 85
description: Country music singer-songwriter Tom T. Hall died Friday at his home in Franklin, Tennessee, at the age of 85, according to his son.

title: Melissa Joan Hart, fully vaccinated and sick with Covid, warns others to 'stay vigilant'
description: Actress Melissa Joan Hart has revealed she's quite sick with Covid, despite being fully vaccinated and wants to encourage others to "stay safe."

title: When you can see the rare 'blue moon' this August 21-23
description: This weekend is your next chance to catch the rare full blue moon before it again becomes "just a memory" until 2024.

title: Euro 2020 final at Wembley was a 'superspreader' event
description: The Euro 2020 soccer final between England and Italy in July was a "superspreader" event due to the level of COVID-19 infection found in or around London's Wembley Stadium on the day, according to official data published on Friday.

title: New Englanders brace for what could be the first hurricane in 30 years
description: Severe weather warnings have been issued across the Northeast as millions of people prepare for what could be the first hurricane to hit New England in 30 years.

title: Taliban celebrate their new American arsenal
description: US national security officials are working to account for more than 20 years worth of weapons provided to the Afghan military as images of Taliban fighters brandishing American-made rifles and riding in abandoned Humvees are raising concerns about what else was left behind.

title: Masters champion's tee shot lands in spectator's shirt
description: It's par for the course for a golfer's shot to occasionally land in a water hazard or the rough, but Hideki Matsuyama's drive ended up in a spectator's shirt at The Northern Trust tournament on Friday.

title: Australia suffers its worst day of Covid-19 pandemic as anti-lockdown protests flare
description: Thousands of protesters defied coronavirus lockdowns to hit the streets of Australia's largest cities on Saturday, as the country recorded its highest single-day caseload since the pandemic began.

title: Village near Rome joins Italy's €1 home sell-off
description: Italy's ongoing clearance sale of €1 houses has been ideal for people seeking to start a new life in some of the country's far-flung corners.

title: Unruly air passengers hit with $500,000 in new fines
description: While our passports haven't been getting many stamps since March 2020, at least our vocabularies are expanding. Variants, mandates, quarantines and requirements -- who knew 2021 would be so polysyllabic?

title: Grace makes landfall as a category 3 hurricane in Mexico
description: Grace, a category 3 hurricane, made landfall south of Tuxpan on the eastern coast of Mexico early Saturday, as the president urged residents in its path to seek refuge in shelters or on higher ground.

title: Man charged after allegedly stealing and reselling more than 23,000 US Open tickets
description: A Philadelphia-area man was charged with allegedly embezzling more than $3 million in tickets to the United States Open Championship over seven years, according to the US Attorneys Office for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania.

title: Analysis: Biden's reassurances on Afghanistan contradict chaotic images on the ground
description: As Americans watched chaotic and often heartbreaking scenes of desperation around the airport in Kabul this week, President Joe Biden on Friday vowed to do everything in his power to bring Americans home safely from Afghanistan as that nation descends into chaos under Taliban control.

title: California judge rules gig worker initiative utilized by Uber and Lyft is unconstitutional
description: A California judge ruled Friday that the costly and controversial 2020 ballot measure exempting firms like Uber and Lyft from having to classify their gig workers in the state as employees rather than as independent contractors is unconstitutional.

title: BLM protesters were targeted by federal government with stiffer punishments, an analysis shows
description: The Justice Department targeted more than 300 protesters by charging them with federal crimes for their roles during the civil unrest last summer after the murder of George Floyd, according to a new report from The Movement for Black Lives, a coalition of Black advocacy groups.

title: As Taliban fighters swarmed Kabul, two friends looked for the fastest route out
description: Zahra shelters in her Kabul apartment, anxiously peering through the window at Taliban fighters in the parking lot below. She hasn't dared to leave her house for days.

title: Woman who struck 2 children with her car sentenced to 25 years for hate crimes
description: An Iowa woman was sentenced to 25 years in federal prison on Thursday for trying to kill two children by running them over with her car because she believed they were Mexican or of Middle Eastern or African descent.

title: Full FDA approval of Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine is 'imminent'
